All discussions should be in English. And this is a discussion, and submit to there.

Log APIs - https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rust/pull/41
Metrics APIs - https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rust/pull/44
@wu-sheng @wankai123 Would you please provide some use cases to verify this feature? I want to add them to the UTs.

What kinds of cases do you need? What text should be supported for text searching?

Typically, there are
**GET::/root/product/order** should be able to search through `root`, `product`, `order`, `/root/product`, `/product/order` or `GET`, `GET::/root`.

**org.apache.skywalking.test.service.OrderService.order**(an example of Dubbo or gRPC) should be able to search by `org`, `org.apache`, `org.apach....OrderService`, `OrderService.order` etc.

`.`, `/`, `whitespace`, `,`, `:`, `new line`, `;`, `'`, `"` should be considered as typical stop words.  The list includes some chars which are useful in Log search case only. But I remember BanyanDB is not supporting text-based query for log rawtext, right? If so, usually `.`, `/`, `whitespace`, `,`, `:` matters.

>  But I remember BanyanDB is not supporting text-based query for log rawtext, right?

We could create an index rule with a simple analyzer to log raw text(its data type should be a string instead of binary) for searching. The simple analyzer will break text at any non-letter character.

If you want to add this capability, it is good. @lujiajing1126 would need to adjust the banyand storage implementation to declare the log query supporting text search, otherwise, the UI would block the query from end users as it is right now.
Read the cluster management doc, it is clear to tell you how to set the configuration. You just use the default config to cluster mode, which is wrong.
Besides, when my application have 3025 thread running on same machine, the `SkywalkingAgent-5-JVMService-produce-0` thread consistently spends around 16.1% of the cpu.
I reopen this to track that our dashboard is not set for network profiling. Pending on @mrproliu

The mTLS cert is expired yesterday... I have extended the expiration date to 100 years

Hey @kezhenxu94, Apologies for the delay in raising the PR. I had a few questions to ask sorry if these are too dumb

1.  How will I test the created docker image? The docker images are getting created using the `buildx` command and I am able to run it but is there any command to run in the docker container to run the test cases?
2.  Do we need to really use `buildx` command to build the docker image and not just when pushing it? As the --load keyword will not create multiplatform images, so we can just use the normal build command as we will not be creating a builder then removing it at the end,
4.  In the MakeFile the [docker-release](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L82-L83) recipe already contains the docker build and push command then why is there another tag and push command? Can't just `docker-release : docker docker-push` work?
5. Do we need to change architecture for build recipe too? As I can see we are creating [`ARCH`](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L22) variable but then [overriding](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L36) it by `amd64` value.

> 1.  How will I test the created docker image? The docker images are getting created using the `buildx` command and I am able to run it but is there any command to run in the docker container to run the test cases?

No, the final docker image is for end user' use so there is no test case in that image anymore. Just feel free to run the `license-eye version` and if it succeeds it's ok enough. 

> 2.  Do we need to really use `buildx` command to build the docker image and not just when pushing it? As the --load keyword will not create multiplatform images, so we can just use the normal build command as we will not be creating a builder then removing it at the end,

We don't have to. Using `buildx` for both loading and pushing is just for simplifying the script if you find it simpler to use plain docker build for local build and buildx for publishing, just do it!

> 4.  In the MakeFile the [docker-release](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L82-L83) recipe already contains the docker build and push command then why is there another tag and push command? Can't just `docker-release : docker docker-push` work?

`docker-release : docker docker-push` just works. As a convention, a Docker image will be also tagged as `latest` (if it's latest) so users can just run `docker run apache/skywalking-eye ...` without adding an explicit version, i.e. `docker run apache/skywalking-eye:0.6.0 ...`.

> 5. Do we need to change architecture for build recipe too? As I can see we are creating [`ARCH`](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L22) variable but then [overriding](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L36) it by `amd64` value.

The first `ARCH` is just for [determining the OS](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-eyes/blob/00b35e521822654568ab65d93cced7a986e46bc6/Makefile#L23) and the second one is real ARCH. Sorry they have the same name to confuse. You can also rename one of them in your PR.

I think there is a mistake in the build recipe as it only builds one arch variation for macOS, which I expect it should generate for both amd and arm. Do you want to fix that first?
I found this issue , should I reopen an issue to update jedis plugin ?
I have opened new issue https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9534

I want put  interceptor class to this module . I don't guarantee  this module  can apply to jedis 5.x  in  future . 
The future-man  should notice it .
Make sense.

> @wu-sheng If other agent do not enhance the class during the first load (transform), the class will be enhanced during the second transform. Then skywalking directly returns the byte stream cached for the first time in the second time, will it overwrite the content enhanced for the second time by other agents? Because the order in which the transform is executed depends on the order in which the Agent is configured.

I think this feature (class cache) only solve the conflict of  skywalking and other agent which do not modify the origin class logic. If we use other agent to enable hotswap, it will not work well.
Ideally, yes, we shoud keep them independent, unless they share some commons package.
Are you going to submit this soon? I plan to release 8.12.0 recently.
Are you going to submit this soon? I plan to release 8.12.0 recently.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/f1f519cae469f2f3d9e3b8f81648b80536090444/oap-server/server-receiver-plugin/zipkin-receiver-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/receiver/zipkin/trace/SpanForward.java#L69

Errors in logs
```
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.zipkin.trace.SpanForward.lambda$send$0(SpanForward.java:69) ~[zipkin-receiver-plugin-9.1.0.jar:9.1.0]
	at java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1259) ~[?:1.8.0_332]
	at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.zipkin.trace.SpanForward.send(SpanForward.java:52) ~[zipkin-receiver-plugin-9.1.0.jar:9.1.0]
	at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.zipkin.handler.ZipkinSpanHTTPHandler.lambda$doCollectSpans$0(ZipkinSpanHTTPHandler.java:119) ~[zipkin-receiver-plugin-9.1.0.jar:9.1.0]
```
@etchevef Would you like to add a `not null` check to `span.localEndpoint()` before getting `ipv4`/`ipv6`, and test again locally?

This should be fixed through https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9252 in the 9.2.0.

The release should be available on Friday, and the tag exists already.

> > @wu-sheng If other agent do not enhance the class during the first load (transform), the class will be enhanced during the second transform. Then skywalking directly returns the byte stream cached for the first time in the second time, will it overwrite the content enhanced for the second time by other agents? Because the order in which the transform is executed depends on the order in which the Agent is configured.
> 
> I think this feature (class cache) only solve the conflict of skywalking and other agent which do not modify the origin class logic. If we use other agent to enable hotswap, it will not work well.

Class cache is not a perfect solution. This can be a problem if another agent loads before the Skywalking agent. When retransform the same class a second time, the result of the first retransform is used. Cause the agent Retransform result before Skywalking to be overwritten. Functions such as hot-loading class will not be available. 
This problem can be completely solved by improving ByteBuddy or replacing bytecode tools such as Arthas's ByteKit. I want to do something for it, it might take a while.

> > > @wu-sheng If other agent do not enhance the class during the first load (transform), the class will be enhanced during the second transform. Then skywalking directly returns the byte stream cached for the first time in the second time, will it overwrite the content enhanced for the second time by other agents? Because the order in which the transform is executed depends on the order in which the Agent is configured.
> > 
> > 
> > I think this feature (class cache) only solve the conflict of skywalking and other agent which do not modify the origin class logic. If we use other agent to enable hotswap, it will not work well.
> 
> Class cache is not a perfect solution. This can be a problem if another agent loads before the Skywalking agent. When retransform the same class a second time, the result of the first retransform is used. Cause the agent Retransform result before Skywalking to be overwritten. Functions such as hot-loading class will not be available. This problem can be completely solved by improving ByteBuddy or replacing bytecode tools such as Arthas's ByteKit. I want to do something for it, it might take a while.

Great! I still hava a question: Hotswap by redefine(or retransform) just reload class definition(the latest version) without initializationwhile class enhanced by skywalking dependy on static blockBy improving ByteBuddy can solve this question?

What should I set the `traceId` and `Id` of the `TopNDatabaseStatement`?
Followings are the log of MySQL:
```
mysqld, Version: 5.7.18 (MySQL Community Server (GPL)). started with:
Tcp port: 3306  Unix socket: /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock
Time                 Id Command    Argument
# Time: 2022-08-25T12:12:17.282398Z
# User@Host: root[root] @  [175.172.57.107]  Id:     4
# Query_time: 10.000410  Lock_time: 0.000000 Rows_sent: 1  Rows_examined: 0
SET timestamp=1661429537;
SELECT sleep(10);
# Time: 2022-08-25T12:28:44.460038Z
# User@Host: root[root] @  [175.172.57.107]  Id:     4
# Query_time: 60.001244  Lock_time: 0.000344 Rows_sent: 6  Rows_examined: 6
use sys;
SET timestamp=1661430524;
SELECT sleep(10),variable from sys_config;
```

For the trace ID , I don't think you would have that. 
ID should be encoded in the TopNDatabaseStatement, could you check the source codes?

The ID is generate by traceId and spanId, such as following:
```
slowStatementBuilder.setId(segmentObject.getTraceSegmentId() + "-" + span.getSpanId());
```
The serviceId is encoded in the TopNDatabaseStatement.
I see, the thid should be changed as a generated ID if segmentID and spanID absent.
Does thid mean thread id?
No, ID is required to be globally unique. Is there anything specific isourceoriginal data? Or could the agent fill a UUID tag for every row of data?
I get it. May be need to generate a UUID.
It is better if the agent could generate this ID, and OAP just uses it in the LAL.
You could send a pull request to contribute new plugins for other open source projects.

In skywalking, issue is used for tracking on planned things.

Welcome to submit a pull request to update with updating versions in license using skywalking-eyes tool

I tried to fix this in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9545 and found we are using 1.x but they fix this in 2.x. Also, they started to package all dependency by shading into their client SDK so the package becomes really large, what's more, the dependencies that are packed into the SDK also have CVE, so we have literally NO way to upgrade them. 

In all, we have no way to upgrade to a version without CVE for Nacos.

Do you use nacos or only because it exists to cause CVE? If it's latter you can just remove the related jars out of your environment. 

We have to consider removing nacos related things one day if it becomes unmaintainable like this.

> We have to consider removing nacos related things one day if it becomes unmaintainable like this.

I think we need to submit an issue  to nacos as a warning and suggestion. 
I agree that providing a uber jar is not a good practice for a library.
I am confused about the `latency` of TopNRecord.java , is It the query time of SQL statement? And what is it unit?
Maybe , we should expand  the meaning  of  `Database ` . `Virtual Database`  should  contains  cache  instead of creating `Virtual Cache`
I think they are different, basically. Cache is much faster than database.

They  are used for saving  data , and contain statement  too .
We provide slow threshold config for various DB
```
agent-analyzer:
  selector: ${SW_AGENT_ANALYZER:default}
  default:
    slowDBAccessThreshold: ${SW_SLOW_DB_THRESHOLD:default:200,mongodb:100,redis:20} 
```
We just add `redis:20`
And we could append `dbType` to service name like `Mysql:192.168.1.1:3306` or `Redis:192.168.1.1:6379`, or add  column named dbType to UI
Yes, I don't think this is tech issue. I just talked from design perspective.

> design perspective

It depends how you define Database  . Design comes from Definition .
Let's say in this way, cache should be related to more metrics, such as cache hint is an important metric, database doesn't care about hint rate.

Hint ? means cache hit ?
Data store system can response  a result ,   whether the result is empty or not .From  client-server communication protocol perspective , they are all successful  .
If we want to get  hit rate , we should decode response , It's better if  the response have hit-state  .  However, we cannot guarantee that every cache system protocol has `hit-state ` 
Finally , `Hit` also  is appropriate  for Database (such as Mysql) .

You just described it from a general side, I mean for layer, and for apm, we should understand the service. 
In every official architecture, cache service and database service are two things. This is why we have cache and service span type from many years ago.
You should not say they arevsame just because they have similar metric.
OK , I 'll  follow  current rule . For  a system  the  concept should  be  consistent at  least
And another thing is, that some caches are not remote services. The cache could be local memory.
Should we analysis  local span for  local memory  cache  such  as  guava-cache ?
Yes, we should, and we should provide a format rule to difference local and remote caches.

I submitted one to Nacos, https://github.com/alibaba/nacos/issues/9091

Let's see how they reply from official team.

I don't think adding comments here would help much.

If it is a helm issue, it's better to polish docs and codrs there.
Such as we could default versions of OAP in helm repo to 9.2.0

Latency should be SQL execution time.

>

>

> No, I want to use the TopNStatement metric which declared by OAP. I am already save data in the table `TopNStatement`.What else should I do? 

You could go to virtual database dashboard, check the configuration of slow SQL list. Yours should be the same.
I understand.

The  new config  look like  this :

```yml 
agent-analyzer:
     #......
    virtualService:
      database:
        slowAccessThreshold: ${SW_VIRTUAL_DB_SLOW_THRESHOLD:default:200,mongodb:100}
        maxSlowStatementLength: ${SW_VIRTUAL_DB_SLOW_MAX_LENGTH:default:200,mongodb:100}
      cache:
        slowAccessThreshold: ${SW_VIRTUAL_CACHE_SLOW_THRESHOLD:default:80,redis:30}
        maxSlowStatementLength: ${SW_VIRTUAL_CACHE_SLOW_MAX_LENGTH:default:200,redis:100}
        enableLocal: false # This  term  define  whether  analysis  local cache such  as  Guave-Cache ,Ecache 

```
Do  you have any  suggestion?
Does the kernal support this kind of structure? I remember only 3 levels supported.
Yes  , only  3 levels  supported  , I'll reorganize  this  config ,
We would not simply change that JSON in the runtime or use a variable. Because this JSON is generated from UI's edit mode.

> BTW , I want to modify the kernel for supporting more levels in future

The reason we don't recommend more levels is that, nested YAML file is very hard to be controlled through system env variables, which are the key parts of how helm/operator(cloud-native) components control the OAP behaviors in the setup stage.

Yep. So if those JSON files are dynamically created, we should change the `graph.url`  generator.
like `"url":"https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/{version:latest}/en/setup/backend/backend-mysql-monitoring/"`

do our best to provide an accurate document

> if this statement doesn't include `key`

Yes, sometimes  we  couldn't  get  the key  from  cache  plugin   , we could  show slow  command in  UI  at  least . It's better  than  noting . 
jedis-4.x -plugin :
```
- {key: db.statement, value: HSET a}
- {key: db.statement, value: SET key}
- {key: db.statement, value: XADD abc}
- {key: db.statement, value: XREAD}    # only command , no key !!
```

> Threshold should be separated for read/write or general operation.

Agree

Not that simple. UI is using the same GraphQL query to get the current value, so, when you do so, UI would show `https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/{version:latest}/en/setup/backend/backend-mysql-monitoring/` for the link.

Then, link fails. (404)

> Yes, sometimes we couldn't get the key from cache plugin , we could show slow command in UI at least . It's better than noting .

Not really. If we show meaningless information, we cost the resources(CPU, storage, network, a.k.a. user's money) for nothing. In your case `key: db.statement, value: XREAD` should not be sampled as a slow statement, no matter how slow it is. Because in the APM use case, ppl(ops team) could be nothing to get rid of it. We have provided the latency(avg and percentile) to show the access speed.

Also, besides read and write slow access threshold, metrics should be separated too.

You are right, of course not that simple. I mean that's just a grammar demo.
I'm not good for the front end. That's why I suggest discussing it.

We can't distinguish between reading and writing unless  we  modify  all cache plugin for uniform read/write flag 
Also , We  can't  know  if the  statement  include  key .

The difficulty is not about changing UI. The thing is, we don't have an API to provide a service like this, and we never think we should make things so complex. Read doc with the version you prefer/need, we assume this is a basic requirement for oss users.

Also, when you take a look Function menu, it even links to a 3rd party page.
 Aliyun gateway team is planning to contribute a dashboard for their gateway service too. If they really do, we have to link it to an Aliyun dev doc page as well.

You can see, as a widely adopted project, this is not a simple tech solution.
OK, then the value of these metrics would be lower than we could be.
